triplets: Sports equipment designed for hitting a baseball in the game of baseball
Hitting baseballs in games, practice sessions, and training for baseball or softball
Wood (maple, ash, or birch) or metal (aluminum, alloy), with rubber or synthetic grip tape for handle
Grip at the handle end to provide better hold and control
Barrel, the thicker hitting portion designed to strike the ball
Varies depending on material, manufacturer, and customization; wooden bats often natural or stained, metal bats can be painted or anodized
Baseball games, training sessions, sports equipment collections, and competitive leagues
Various sports equipment manufacturers producing wooden, metal, and custom bats
Typically 0.9–1.2 kg depending on size, material, and league regulations
Approximately 70–100 cm in length depending on type and player age group
Wooden bats can last 1–5 years depending on usage and care; metal bats can last 5–10 years or more with proper maintenance
